verses.text: O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, thou hast \w searched|strong="H2713"\w* me, and \w known|strong="H3045"\w* \add me\add*.

Thou \w knowest|strong="H3045"\w* my \w downsitting|strong="H3427"\w* and mine \w uprising|strong="H6965"\w*, thou \w understandest|strong="H0995"\w* my \w thought|strong="H7454"\w* afar \w off|strong="H7350"\w*.

Thou \w compassest|strong="H2219"\w* my \w path|strong="H0734"\w* and my lying \w down|strong="H7252"\w*, and art \w acquainted|strong="H5532"\w* \add with\add* all my \w ways|strong="H1870"\w*.\f + \fr 139.3 \ft compassest: or, winnowest\f*
For \add there is\add* not a \w word|strong="H4405"\w* in my \w tongue|strong="H3956"\w*, \add but\add*, lo, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, thou \w knowest|strong="H3045"\w* it altogether.
Thou hast \w beset|strong="H6696"\w* me \w behind|strong="H0268"\w* and \w before|strong="H6924"\w*, and \w laid|strong="H7896"\w* thine \w hand|strong="H3709"\w* upon me.
\add Such\add* \w knowledge|strong="H1847"\w* \add is\add* too \w wonderful|strong="H6383"\w* for me; it is \w high|strong="H7682"\w*, I \w cannot|strong="H3201"\w* \add attain\add* unto it.
Whither shall I \w go|strong="H3212"\w* from thy \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w*? or whither shall I \w flee|strong="H1272"\w* from thy \w presence|strong="H6440"\w*?
If I ascend \w up|strong="H5266"\w* into \w heaven|strong="H8064"\w*, thou \add art\add* there: if I make my \w bed|strong="H3331"\w* in \w hell|strong="H7585"\w*, behold, thou \add art there\add*.

\add If\add* I \w take|strong="H5375"\w* the \w wings|strong="H3671"\w* of the \w morning|strong="H7837"\w*, \add and\add* \w dwell|strong="H7931"\w* in the uttermost \w parts|strong="H0319"\w* of the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*;
Even there shall thy \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* \w lead|strong="H5148"\w* me, and thy right \w hand|strong="H3225"\w* shall \w hold|strong="H0270"\w* me.

If I \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, Surely the \w darkness|strong="H2822"\w* shall \w cover|strong="H7779"\w* me; even the \w night|strong="H3915"\w* shall be \w light|strong="H0216"\w* about \w me|strong="H1157"\w*.

Yea, the \w darkness|strong="H2822"\w* \w hideth|strong="H2821"\w* not from thee; but the \w night|strong="H3915"\w* \w shineth|strong="H0215"\w* as the \w day|strong="H3117"\w*: the \w darkness|strong="H2825"\w* and the \w light|strong="H0219"\w* \add are\add* both alike \add to thee\add*.\f + \fr 139.12 \ft hideth…: Heb. darkeneth not\f*\f + \fr 139.12 \ft the darkness and…: Heb. as is the darkness, so is the light\f*
For thou hast \w possessed|strong="H7069"\w* my \w reins|strong="H3629"\w*: thou hast \w covered|strong="H5526"\w* me in my \w mother’s|strong="H0517"\w* \w womb|strong="H0990"\w*.

I will \w praise|strong="H3034"\w* thee; for I am \w fearfully|strong="H3372"\w* \add and\add* wonderfully \w made|strong="H6395"\w*: \w marvellous|strong="H6381"\w* \add are\add* thy \w works|strong="H4639"\w*; and \add that\add* my \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* \w knoweth|strong="H3045"\w* right \w well|strong="H3966"\w*.\f + \fr 139.14 \ft right…: Heb. greatly\f*

My \w substance|strong="H6108"\w* was not \w hid|strong="H3582"\w* from thee, when I was \w made|strong="H6213"\w* in \w secret|strong="H5643"\w*, \add and\add* curiously \w wrought|strong="H7551"\w* in the lowest \w parts|strong="H8482"\w* of the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*.\f + \fr 139.15 \ft substance: or, strength, or, body\f*

Thine \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* did \w see|strong="H7200"\w* my substance, yet being \w unperfect|strong="H1564"\w*; and in thy \w book|strong="H5612"\w* all \add my members\add* were \w written|strong="H3789"\w*, \add which\add* in \w continuance|strong="H3117"\w* were \w fashioned|strong="H3335"\w*, when \add as yet there was\add* \w none|strong="H0259"\w* of them.\f + \fr 139.16 \ft all…: Heb. all of them\f*\f + \fr 139.16 \ft which…: or, what days they should be fashioned\f*
How \w precious|strong="H3365"\w* also are thy \w thoughts|strong="H7454"\w* unto me, O \w God|strong="H0410"\w*! how \w great|strong="H6105"\w* is the \w sum|strong="H7218"\w* of them!

\add If\add* I should \w count|strong="H5608"\w* them, they are more in \w number|strong="H7235"\w* than the \w sand|strong="H2344"\w*: when I \w awake|strong="H6974"\w*, I am \w still|strong="H5750"\w* with thee.

Surely thou wilt \w slay|strong="H6991"\w* the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w*, O \w God|strong="H0433"\w*: \w depart|strong="H5493"\w* from me therefore, ye \w bloody|strong="H1818"\w* \w men|strong="H0582"\w*.

For they \w speak|strong="H0559"\w* against thee \w wickedly|strong="H4209"\w*, \add and\add* thine \w enemies|strong="H6145"\w* \w take|strong="H5375"\w* \add thy name\add* in \w vain|strong="H7723"\w*.

Do not I \w hate|strong="H8130"\w* them, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that \w hate|strong="H8130"\w* thee? and am not I \w grieved|strong="H6962"\w* with those that rise \w up|strong="H8618"\w* against thee?
I \w hate|strong="H8130"\w* them with \w perfect|strong="H8503"\w* \w hatred|strong="H8135"\w*: I count them mine \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w*.

\w Search|strong="H2713"\w* me, O \w God|strong="H0410"\w*, and \w know|strong="H3045"\w* my \w heart|strong="H3824"\w*: \w try|strong="H0974"\w* me, and \w know|strong="H3045"\w* my \w thoughts|strong="H8312"\w*:

And \w see|strong="H7200"\w* if \add there be any\add* \w wicked|strong="H6090"\w* \w way|strong="H1870"\w* in me, and \w lead|strong="H5148"\w* me in the \w way|strong="H1870"\w* \w everlasting|strong="H5769"\w*.\f + \fr 139.24 \ft wicked…: Heb. way of pain, or, grief\f*
